events.text: On the start of the layout, set up EVERYTHING, basically
Every frame, set the player and projetiles to the top of the layer

events.title: PickUps
events.description: Functions to do with pick ups are placed here

parameters.audio-file: Health Pickup

events.title: Projectiles
events.description: Functions to do with ALL projectiles are placed here (mainly arrows, both enemy and player arrows)

children.title: Enemy Arrows
children.description: Functions to do with Enemy Arrows are here

children.text: When the enemy arrow collides with the player (and the player isn't dashing) do damage to the player and destroy the enemy arrow, while spawning blood particles, and flickering the player's damaged animation (turning the player red over and over again), with a little screen shake

parameters.audio-file: Arrow Shooting Sound Play at -5 DB

children.text: When the enemy arrow collides with TiledWalls, Walls, Pillaer, OR the Arena 1 Pillar, destroy the arrow.

children.title: Arrows
children.description: Player's Projectiles & their behaviours

children.text: When the arrow hits anything designated as a wall or tiledwall, and it's not a ricochet arrow, spawn the arrow hit particle effect, set the angle right, and then destroy the arrow.
When the arrow hits anything designated as a wall or tiledwall, and it IS a ricochet arrow, spawn the arrow hit particle effect, and then set the angle right

When the arrow hits any enemies, and it's not PIERCING through that enemy, (IE it can't travel through the enemy), spawn the arrow hit particle effect, set the angle right, and then destroy the arrow.

When the arrow hits an enemy, spawn the hit particle effect, then subtract the attack power + brittle damage from their health, set the enemies to their hurt animation over and over again, and subtract the enemies it can hit (piercing variable) by 1. Underneath will be the arrows functions for piercing, destroying itself, and dealing elemental status effects
If the enemiesitcanhit is greater than two, subtract 1 from that variable.
If the enemiesitcanhit is less than 2, destroy the arrow on collision
If the element is fire, burn the enemy if it is not true, add to the burn damage if it IS burning, and under 3 damage/tick of damage
If the element is Ice, set brittle to true
If the element is Electric, set the animation to Electric, and set the the Dash Bar & damage text's font color to that element
If the element is Ice, set the animation to Ice, and set the the Dash Bar & damage text's font color to that element
If the element is Fire, set the animation to Fire, and set the the Dash Bar & damage text's font color to that element
When the enemy collides with the melee enemies, push the enemy back a bit, then continue on
when the arrow is destroyed, spawn the arrow particle effect, and set the angle right.
When the arrow is spawned, it'll set it's bullet to enabled (so it can fire)

events.title: Player
events.description: Functions to do with the Player are placed here

children.title: Player Abilities
children.description: Player Ability Functions are placed here

children.title: Piercing Shot
children.description: Shots go through more than one enemy

children.text: When you've got JUST piercing shot
When the arrow has traveled more than 400 pixels, it'll destroy itself (so 400 pixel range)
If the Left Mouse Button is down -OR- the gamepad's {insert button here} is down, every .17 seconds, fire an arrow.
Play the arrow shooting audio here

parameters.audio-file: Arrow Shooting Sound Play at -5 DB

children.text: When you're using pierce shot AND multishot
When the arrow has traveled more than 300 pixels, it'll destroy itself (so 300 pixel range)
If the Left Mouse Button is down -OR- the gamepad's {insert button here} is down, every .17 seconds, fire your arrows.
Play the arrow shooting audio here. Currently disabled because it's going to sound annoying.

parameters.audio-file: Arrow Shooting Sound Play at -5 DB

children.text: When you're using pierce shot AND charged shot
When you're not fully charged, and the arrow has traveled more than 400 pixels, it'll destroy itself (so 400 pixel range when not charged up)
When you ARE fully charged, and the arrow has traveled more than 500 pixels, it'll destroy itself (so 500 pixel range when not charged up)

If the Left Mouse Button is down -OR- the gamepad's {insert button here} is down, and the Right Mouse Button -OR- the gamepad's {insert button here} is NOT down, every .17 seconds, fire your arrows. (this stops you from being able to fire normal arrows while charging up your shot)
Play the arrow shooting audio here. Disabled because it will sound annoying.

parameters.audio-file: Arrow Shooting Sound Play at -5 DB
Arrow Shooting Sound Play at -5 DB

children.text: When the right mouse button is down, every .5 seconds, charge up your shot.
When the charged power is greater than 1, half the movement speed of the player
While the CS power is less than or equal to 2, reduce the size of the sprite (IE: honing in)
When the right mouse button (or the gamepad's charge shot button) is released, return the reticle to normal size, PLAY THE ARROW SHOOTING SOUND, return full speed to the player, and fire the arrow.

parameters.audio-file: Arrow Shooting Sound Play at -5 DB

children.text: When the Charged Shot power is less than or equal to 1, fire the arrow. This arrow WILL NOT be powered up, and WILL NOT ricochet.
When the Charged Shot power is greater than or equal to 2, fire the arrow. This arrow WILL be powered up, and WILL ricochet.
reset the charging power to 0

children.title: Charged Shot
children.description: Hold down to power up a shot & then shoot it to do more damage

children.text: When the charging power is greater than or equal to 2, set the animation of the sprite to it's "full charge" animation
When the charging power is less than 2, set the animation of the sprite to it's "normal" animation
If you are JUST using Charged Shot
if the charging power is less than or equal to 1, and the arrow has traveled more than 400 pixels, it'll destroy itself (so 400 pixel range)
if the charging power is greater than or equal to 2, and the arrow has traveled more than 500 pixels, it'll destroy itself (so 500 pixel range)

If the Left Mouse Button is down -OR- the gamepad's {insert button here} is down, and the Right Mouse Button -OR- the gamepad's {insert button here} is NOT down, every .17 seconds, fire your arrows. (this stops you from being able to fire normal arrows while charging up your shot) (gamepad portion not implemented yet)

parameters.audio-file: Arrow Shooting Sound Play at -5 DB

children.text: When the right mouse button is down, every .5 seconds, charge up your shot.
When the charged power is greater than 1, half the movement speed of the player
While the CS power is less than or equal to 2, reduce the size of the sprite (IE: showing the charging of the arrow)
When the right mouse button (or the gamepad's charge shot button) is released, return the reticle to normal size, PLAY THE ARROW SHOOTING SOUND, return full speed to the player, and fire the arrow.

parameters.audio-file: Arrow Shooting Sound Play at -5 DB

children.text: When the Charged Shot power is less than or equal to 1, fire the arrow. This arrow WILL NOT be powered up, and WILL NOT ricochet.
When the Charged Shot power is greater than or equal to 2, fire the arrow. This arrow WILL be powered up, and WILL ricochet.
reset the charging power to 0
When you're using BOTH multishot AND charged shot
if the charging power is greater than or equal to 2, and the arrow has traveled more than 300 pixels, it'll destroy itself (so 300 pixel range)
if the charging power is less than or equal to 2, and the arrow has traveled more than 400 pixels, it'll destroy itself (so 400 pixel range)

If the Left Mouse Button is down -OR- the gamepad's {insert button here} is down, and the Right Mouse Button -OR- the gamepad's {insert button here} is NOT down, every .17 seconds, fire your arrows. (this stops you from being able to fire normal arrows while charging up your shot) (gamepad portion not implemented yet)
if the arrow has traveled more than 350 pixels, it'll destroy itself (so 350 pixel range) (This is specifically for normal shots, not the charging shots or the charged shots)
PLAY THE ARROW SHOOTING SOUNDS HERE

parameters.audio-file: Arrow Shooting Sound Play at -5 DB

children.text: When the right mouse button is down, every .5 seconds, charge up your shot.
reset the charging power to 0
When the charged power is greater than 1, half the movement speed of the player
While the CS power is less than or equal to 2, reduce the size of the reticle sprite (IE: showing the charging of the arrow)

When the right mouse button (or the gamepad's charge shot button) is released, return the reticle to normal size, PLAY THE ARROW SHOOTING SOUND, return full speed to the player, and fire the arrow. Gamepad not implemented yet

parameters.audio-file: Arrow Shooting Sound Play at -5 DB

children.text: When the Charged Shot power is less than or equal to 1, fire the arrow. This arrow WILL NOT be powered up, and WILL NOT ricochet, and it will reset the CS_Power to 0
When the Charged Shot power is greater than or equal to 2, fire the arrow. This arrow WILL be powered up, and WILL ricochet, and it will reset the CS_Power to 0

children.title: Multishot
children.description: Fires 3 arrows in a cone in front of the player

children.text: When you're using multishot (even paired with other abilities), you'll reduce the amount of damage you can do by half.
When you're JUST using multishot
When the arrow has traveled more than 300 pixels, it'll destroy itself (so 300 pixel range)
If the Left Mouse Button is down -OR- the gamepad's {insert button here} is down, every .17 seconds, fire your arrows.

parameters.audio-file: Arrow Shooting Sound Play at -5 DB

children.title: Dash
children.description: Press Space Bar to Dash forward, leaving a trail of elements behind you

children.text: When you press the Space Bar (or whatever dash button) and dash is NOT on CD, do the dash

parameters.audio-file: Dash

children.text: after 1.5 seconds, set the dash CD to false
While you are dashing, you can't be collided with anything with "Enemy" tag (so you won't get stuck on enemies when you're dashing)
if you picked electric, spawn the electric stuff
if you picked ice, spawn the ice stuff
if you picked fire, spawn the fire stuff
when the dash particle's animations are done, they destroy themselves
Player stops bouncing (bullet maneuver) when you collide with a wall (so you can't dash through walls)
When the ranged enemy collides with fire particles, arrow particles, or dash paths, do the things
if you chose electric, paralyze them for 5 seconds
if you chose ice, freeze them for 5 seconds
if you chose fire, burn them for 4.5 seconds
When the orc boss is collides with fire particles, arrow particles, or dash paths, do the things
if you chose electric, paralyze them for 5 seconds
if you chose ice, freeze them for 5 seconds
if you chose fire, burn them for 4.5 seconds
When bob, that bastard is collides with fire particles, arrow particles, or dash paths, do the things
if you chose electric, paralyze them for 5 seconds
if you chose ice, freeze them for 5 seconds
if you chose fire, burn them for 4.5 seconds
When the melee enemy collides with fire particles, arrow particles, or dash paths, do the things
if you chose electric, paralyze them for 5 seconds
if you chose ice, freeze them for 5 seconds
if you chose fire, burn them for 4.5 seconds

children.title: Basic Bow
children.description: Just fires one shot in the direction you're facing

children.text: When you choose NO abilities
When the arrow has traveled more than 350 pixels, it'll destroy itself (so 350 pixel range)
If the Left Mouse Button is down -OR- the gamepad's {insert button here} is down, every .17 seconds, fire an arrow.
Play the arrow shooting audio here

parameters.audio-file: Arrow Shooting Sound Play at -5 DB

events.title: Enemies
events.description: Functions to do with Enemies are placed here

children.text: When the enemies are outside of the layout, destroy them. This is to protect against any enemies that may somehow, somewhere, pop up outside of the arenas
When the enemy's health is less than or equal to zero, spawn their kill particles, set their visibility to invisible, disable their collisions and movement, wait for all that, and then destroy them
when the enemies are destroyed, subtract 1 from EnemyCount. This is where we would put any kind of universal enemy death sounds
When the enemy is hit by the ZapRadius (electric arrow stuff), subtract 1 from their health

children.title: Status Effects
children.description: Functions to do with Enemy Status Effects are placed here

children.title: Shared Status Effects
children.description: Status Effects that are shared are placed here

children.text: When the enemy is brittle, their move speed is reduced by 20% for 5 seconds, and they take 1 extra damage from arrows

children.title: Minor Enemy Status Effects
children.description: Status Effects for Ranged & Melee enemies are placed here

children.title: Mask Enemy Status Effect
children.description: Status Effects for Ranged Enemies are placed here

children.text: When the enemy is burning, every second, do burn damage, spawn damage text, and play the burning animation
When the enemy is frozen, set their animation to their Frozen animation, and increase the time between their shots for 5 seconds
When the enemy is paralyzed, set their animation to paralyzed, and disable their turret (they can't shoot) for 5 seconds

children.title: Skeleton Enemy Status Effects
children.description: Status Effects for Melee Enemies are placed here

children.text: When the enemy is burning, every second, do burn damage, spawn damage text, and play the burning animation
When the enemy is frozen, set their animation to their Frozen animation, and reduce the speed at which they can travel for 5 seconds
When the enemy is paralyzed, set their animation to paralyzed, and disable their movement capabilities for 5 seconds

children.title: Boss Status Effects
children.description: Status Effects for Boss enemies are placed here

children.title: Orc Boss Status Effect
children.description: Status Effects for the Orc Boss are placed here

children.text: When the boss is burning, every second, do burn damage, spawn damage text, and play the burning animation

children.title: Rogue Boss Status Effect
children.description: Status Effects for the Rogue Boss are placed here

children.text: When the boss is burning, every second, do burn damage, spawn damage text, and play the burning animation

children.title: Minor Enemies
children.description: Functions to do with Minor Enemies are placed here

children.title: Mask Enemy
children.description: Functions to do with the Ranged Enemy are placed here

children.text: When the enemy has LOS of the player, acquire the target.
When the enemy has a target, shoot the arrows at the player

children.title: Skeleton Enemy
children.description: Functions to do with the Melee Enemy are placed here

children.text: When the enemy collides with another enemy, bounce off eachother

When the enemy collides with the player, and the player isn't dashing, damage the player, spawn the blood particles, do some screen shake, push the player back a bit, PLAY THE PLAYER HURT SOUND, and play the player hurt animation. Knock back might not work

parameters.audio-file: Punch Flinch Audio

children.text: When the enemy has LOS of the player, move towards the player
Every tick, add the walls to the enemy's LOS obstacles (they can't see through walls)

children.title: Bosses
children.description: Functions to do with Boss Enemies are placed here

children.title: Sharaglakesh
children.description: Orc Shaman who throws acid flasks at the player, sometimes the acid does a DoT effect, sometimes it pushes the player back

children.text: Boss moves to the travel waypoints when it's told
Every 5 seconds, the boss's destination will increase by 1 until it resets.
When the boss is overlapping a travel waypoint, and has LOS of the player, every .5 seconds, throw an acid flask at the player.
When the acid flask hits the player, do damage, and do the damage stuff

parameters.audio-file: Punch Flinch Audio

children.text: if the animation is 1, poison the player
if the animation is 2, knock the player back
when the player is overlapping the acid pools, deal damage || Add damage text
When the flask is destroyed, spawn an acid pool

parameters.audio-file: Boss 1 Flask Explosion

children.text: set the animation of the pool to the animation of the flask
when the flask has arrived at it's destination, destroy  itself
when the player is poisoned, do poison damage every 1 second || Add damage text
every second, and the game isn't paused, increase the size of the acid area
Play boss music when the boss is present

parameters.audio-file: 1st Boss Fight Music
Boss 1 Evil Laugh

children.text: When the acid area has been in the game too long, destroy itself
when the orcboss dies, remove 1 from OrcBossPresent

children.title: Bob
children.description:
This bastard was a cultist all along. Bob stabs the player at the beginning as a cheap shot, and every once in a while bob will try to dash towards the player and stab them.

Player has reduced visibility due to a shadow vignette affecting the screen.

children.text: Boss moves to the travel waypoints when it's told
When the boss has arrived at it's destination, and has LOS of the player, "dash" at the player
Every 7 seconds cycle through the travel waypoints it's supposed to be at
When the enemy's "melee attack" hits the player, do the damage, destroy the "melee attack" and turn the boss visible again.

parameters.audio-file: Punch Flinch Audio

children.text: When the boss has arrived where it is supposed to be, and there is an errant "melee attack" out there, destroy it. Set it's visibility to visible.
Every tick set the vignette to the player's position and at the top of the layer
when the boss hits the enemy, deal damage and do damage stuff

parameters.audio-file: Punch Flinch Audio

children.text: when there is a boss present, play the boss music once.

parameters.audio-file: 2nd Boss Fight Music
Boss 2 Evil Laugh

children.title: Xanesh
children.description:
The grim reaper wields a heavy 2-handed scythe and will use a mix of melee and ranged magical attacks at you.

Scythe melee strike will insta kill

Shoots out blades that ricochet off walls that will hurt the player if they stand in them

children.text: every .75 seconds, fire an arrow
